Package xxl.core.xml.storage

This package contains classes which support native XML storage.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
BulkLoadingHandler Inserts the parsed XML document in bulk insertion fashion into an empty XML tree.
EXTree This class allows the efficient storage of an XML-Tree.
EXTree.TreeQuality Result type for checkTreeQuality.
LiteralNode This class is an extention of the abstract class Node.
MarkupNode This class is an extention of the abstract class Node.
MatrixSplit This class provides a split algorithm for the EXTree which uses a SplitMatrix to control which types of Nodes schould be clustered.
Node The super class of all nodes of the EXTree.
NodeConverter Converter for a single node of arbitrary node type.
ProxyNode This class is an extention of the abstract class Node.
SAXHandlers This class contains some SAX Handlers which are quite useful in conjunction with the EXTree.
ScaffoldNode A Scaffoldnode is used to group child-nodes from a markup node.
SimpleSplit A very basic example of a split algorithm for XML-Subtrees.
Split The Split classes provide methods to split an XML subtree when it gets to big for the blocksize while inserting an new node.
SplitMatrix The split matrix is a way for tailoring the split algorithm of the EXTree to application requirements.
SubtreeConverter Converter which converts a whole subtree (usually to store it inside a Record).
 

Package xxl.core.xml.storage Description

This package contains classes which support native XML storage. The storage is organized similar to the ideas of Christian Kanne and Guido Moerkotte (University of Mannheim, Germany).
